message: Love it. I love Pizzahut. Domino Pizza
In class. No one responded. So I'm here.

Ketchup 🍅

Cuz fries go with ketchup, and McDonalds fries are life
Ketchup,  Tasty, healthy and easy to access. I love Ketchup.
Ketchup because it goes well with pineapple.
Mustard -- even though I hate mustard, because you all picked ketchup.
Ketchup. I don’t really like ketchup, but I hate mustard. As I must pick one, so I choose ketchup.
Ketch up because I don't like mustard

Ketchup. Definitely ketchup. It's a classic condiment. Can't go wrong. It's also very versatile. Put it on a hot-dog. Put it in your pasta. Put it on your banana. The choices are endless.

 

Mustard is mucky and it's sometimes a drag. Just seal it shut and put it in your bag. No need to debate, the choice is clear, ketchup is superior... don't have any fear.
Ketchup, because it goes along with fries
Ketchup, because it has a wider range of application. Can you put mustard on fries? That's weird.

recent_replies.message: I sometimes put mustard on fries (it can be good)!

message: Student scholarship deadline for local folks is April 5th - more info here: https://solaresearch.org/events/lasi/lasi19/lasi19-student-scholarship/. (Ignore the posted deadline).
The stair case entrance upstairs is locked and a few participants aren't sure how to get in. Is there another entrance?
Have a land acknowledgement at the beginning of the Hackathon.

recent_replies.message: Thanks! That was a good call and something that is important.

message: do you mean this?

Hi, I'm Trish! A PhD student in cognitive psychology. I'm here to learn how to organise learning analytic data.

The skills I'm bringing to the hackathon are: interest and knowledge of learning practices. General research skills.

What I'm hoping to learn: how to organize, manipulate and display data in python.

message: Hey all, my name is Surohit Tandon.I am excited to just participate in my first hackathon. I'm pretty excited to put my python data skills to the test and meet other data enthusiasts!
Hi! My name is Alison. I’m a research analyst at Sauder. I graduated from the Cogs program at UBC.  I’ll be presenting the Tableau workshop tomorrow! Any questions?

recent_replies.message: Hi Alison, what would you say some of the limitations of using Tableau are?

Hi Winnie,

I graduated from Slais (UBC's school of Library and Information Studies) and it's great to see some Library/Information Science folks here! I work at the Centre for Teaching, Learning & Technology is a strategist for open education initiatives and will be generally helping out (and co-hosting the design thinking workshop on Friday).

Hi Alison, I am Winnie, a graduate student in library and information studies. In my previous employment, I used QlikView and QlikSense to do data visualization as my previous company chose to buy Qlik instead of Tableau. I am looking forward to learning Tableau.

message:
Hi Everybody, My name is Kofi and I'm in my last year here at UBC as an undergraduate student. I'm really excited to attend HackUBC and am looking forward to getting some hands on experience with data visualization related packages in python!

Would love to hear what people are looking forward to learning?

recent_replies.message: Hi Kofi ! Look forward to having you there
